title: Carly Baretz
text:
tidy: Tidy Tuesday Analysis




library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

historical_spending <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-02-13/historical_spending.csv')

Rows: 13 Columns: 10
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
dbl (10): Year, PercentCelebrating, PerPerson, Candy, Flowers, Jewelry, Gree...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

gifts_age <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-02-13/gifts_age.csv')

Rows: 6 Columns: 9
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Age
dbl (8): SpendingCelebrating, Candy, Flowers, Jewelry, GreetingCards, Evenin...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

gifts_gender <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-02-13/gifts_gender.csv')

Rows: 2 Columns: 9
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Gender
dbl (8): SpendingCelebrating, Candy, Flowers, Jewelry, GreetingCards, Evenin...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

ggplot(data=gifts_age, aes(x= Age, y = Flowers))+ 
  geom_point()+
  ggtitle("Valentines Day Buying Habits and Age")









babynames <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2022/2022-03-22/babynames.csv')

Rows: 1924665 Columns: 5
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (2): sex, name
dbl (3): year, n, prop

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

babynames <- babynames %>% 
 filter(n > 80000)

ggplot(babynames, aes(x= "", y = prop, fill= name))+ 
  geom_col()+
  coord_polar(theta="y")+
  ggtitle("2022 Baby Names for Names With More Than 80,000 Babies")

title: Baby Names
text:
library(tidyverse)
babynames <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2022/2022-03-22/babynames.csv')

babynames <- babynames %>% 
 filter(n > 80000)

ggplot(babynames, aes(x= "", y = prop, fill= name))+ 
  geom_col()+
  coord_polar(theta="y")+
  ggtitle("2022 Baby Names for Names With More Than 80,000 Babies")








Where I found the tidy Tuesday (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data)

title: Carly Baretz
text: I’m Carly Baretz, a sophomore at Pitzer College from New York City studying Human Centered Design and Data Science!

title: Valentines
text:
library("tidyverse")
historical_spending <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-02-13/historical_spending.csv')
gifts_age <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-02-13/gifts_age.csv')
gifts_gender <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-02-13/gifts_gender.csv')

ggplot(data=gifts_age, aes(x= Age, y = Flowers))+ 
  geom_point()+
  ggtitle("Valentines Day Buying Habits and Age")
